Consumer Confidence Declines in October

• October Index: 94.6 (down from 95.6 in September)
• Monthly Change: -1.0 pts
• Context: The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index declined further below 100, signaling persistent caution among consumers about economic conditions.

Source: The Conference Board, *Consumer Confidence Survey, October 2025*.

View all consumer indicators

Financial Data Updates

Notable MoM Changes:
• New Home Sales: August +136,000 (+20.5%)
• Jobless Claims: September +8,000 (+3.5%)
• Southern Border Encounters: September +1,916 (+19.7%)
• Copper Futures: October +0.64 (+14.2%)
• Lumber Futures: October +30 (+5.2%)
• Small Business Optimism: September -2.0 pts (-2.0%)

Site Update

Announcements are now on the home page.

Consumer Price Index (CPI) Update

• September CPI: 324.800 (up from 323.976 in August)
• Monthly Change: +0.25% MoM
• Year-over-Year: +3.0% YoY
• Context: Core CPI rose 0.2%, signaling moderate inflationary pressures

New Indicator: Chicago Fed Survey of Economic Conditions

Added CFSEC Activity Index to track regional business activity in the Seventh Federal Reserve District (IL, IN, IA, MI, WI).

Latest: +15.07 in October (up from -13.76 in September)

View interactive chart

Sustainable Abundance: Automation's Promise and Peril

Tesla's push for automation through Optimus and FSD aims to eliminate poverty and make advanced services universally affordable. But as Amazon automates 600,000 jobs, who benefits when goods get cheaper but opportunity doesn't?

Read the full editorial on the distribution of productivity gains in an automated world.

Read Sustainable Abundance • View employment trends

Housing Market Indicators Update

• Housing Market Index (HMI): 37 in October (up from 32 in September)
• Median Existing Home Price: $415,200 in September (down 1.7% MoM)
• 30-yr Fixed Mortgage Rate: 6.18% in October (down from 6.28% in September)
• Context: Improving builder sentiment and lower rates support housing market recovery, though prices remain high

View all housing indicators

Used Vehicle Value Index Update

• October: 203.6 (down from 207 in September)
• Trend: Declining values suggest softening demand in the used car market
• Context: The index tracks wholesale auction prices, adjusted for seasonality and vehicle mix

View all consumer indicators

Navan IPO Updates

Automatic effectiveness is a SEC provision allowing automatic IPO effectiveness after 20 days during government shutdowns, potentially benefiting Navan (NAVN).

While airlines and hotels could disintermediate travel management, businesses could adopt their own AI for travel management.

Competitors could catch up to Navan's proprietary AI claims with sufficient resources.

View in News

Also, News layout adjusted with new look.

Like it? Hate it? Text: 201-972-5637

Navan IPO - Corporate Travel Platform Goes Public

Navan (NAVN) files for $963M IPO, targeting $6.2B valuation as corporate travel and expense management platform disrupts legacy systems like Concur.

View in News

Sharp Corner

A troubled man becomes increasingly obsessed with the fatal car crashes occurring at the sharp corner in front of his house, leading him down a dangerous path that jeopardizes his family.

▪ Port of LA/LB Twenty-foot Equivalent Units (TEUs): 883,053 in Sep (-7.86% MoM)
▪ China-US 40ft Rate: $1,751 in Oct (down from $1,802 in Sep)
▪ Trade Trends: Softening TEU volumes indicate weakening trade activity, while tariff revenue remains steady at $30B (Sep)

September 2025 Monthly Treasury Statement Update

▪ Budget Surplus: $197.95B (largest since May)
▪ National Debt: Up $495B to $37.5T (+$1.28T YTD)
▪ Tax Revenue: $544B (+58% MoM from Aug)
▪ Interest Expense: $37B (down 60% from Aug's $93B)
▪ FYE Figures: FY25 deficit $1.775T (down $41B from FY24); Net customs duties $195B (up from $88B FY24); Gross interest $1.22T (up from $1.13T FY24)

New Crime Analysis: Hidden Urban Crime

▪ Key Finding: 58% of violent crimes in urban areas never get reported to police
▪ Data Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics National Crime Victimization Survey
▪ Trends: Urban violent crime rose from 19.0 in 2020 to 23.3 in 2022, then stabilized
▪ Demographics: Young Black adults in large cities face highest risks during evening hours

Read full crime analysis

Manufacturing PMI Update

▪ September: 49.1 (+0.4 pts from Aug)
▪ Status: Still in contraction (below 50) but improving
▪ Context: Highest reading since June, signaling potential stabilization

Private Employment Update

▪ September: 134.53M (-32K MoM from Aug)
▪ Trend: Down 35K from July peak of 134.56M
▪ Context: ADP data shows softening in private sector hiring

View all indicators

Federal Court: AAUP v. Rubio ― First Amendment for Non-Citizens

▪ Date: Sept 30, 2025 ― Judge William G. Young
▪ Ruling: Court found administration officials engaged in viewpoint discrimination and chilled pro-Palestinian speech; non-citizens entitled to First Amendment protections under existing precedent.
▪ Significance: Detailed factual findings, novel use of immigration enforcement for political speech condemned; remedy hearing set (relief limited to subordinate officials).

Read full summary on News ▪ Read full 161-page opinion (PDF)
